title: Ivanka Trump ignores questions on President's impeachment trial
description: In Davos, Switzerland, at the World Economic Forum, CNN's Jim Acosta asked Ivanka Trump to comment on the impeachment trial of President Donald Trump.

title: CDC to announce first US case of deadly SARS-like virus
description: The US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention is expected to announce this afternoon that the first case of Wuhan coronavirus has been reported in the United States, in Washington state, a federal source outside the CDC tells CNN.

title: Greta Thunberg: 'Nothing has been done' to tackle climate crisis
description: Greta Thunberg took the stage at the World Economic Forum Tuesday to admonish world leaders for doing "basically nothing" to reduce carbon emissions despite evidence of a looming climate catastrophe.

title: Conor McGregor calls Trump a 'phenomenal president'
description: Fresh from his 40-second demolition of Donald 'Cowboy' Cerrone at the weekend, Conor McGregor has dipped his toe into US politics describing Donald Trump as a "phenomenal president."

title: Analysis: Here's McConnell's biggest problem
description: Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell has made no secret that he wants the impeachment trial of Donald Trump over as soon as possible -- ideally before the President comes to Capitol Hill on February 4 to deliver the annual State of the Union address.

title: Oldest known asteroid strike may have ended Snowball Earth
description: More than two billion years ago, an asteroid slammed into Earth and created a 43-mile wide crater in Western Australia's outback. Now, researchers believe it is the oldest known impact crater, predating others by 200 million years. And it's possible that the impact led to a great thaw as Earth exited a global frozen state.

title: Nadal breezes through Australian Open
description: World No. 1 Rafa Nadal got his Australian Open campaign off to a winning start as he cruised past Bolivian Hugo Dellien 6-2 6-3 6-0.

title: Trump snubs Davos vision in another America-first speech
description: President Donald Trump's speech in Davos was not what many attendees wanted to hear.

title: Men should be allowed to donate sperm after death, study says
description: Sperm donations from dead men is "ethically permissible," say doctors seeking to tackle the shortage of living donors in the UK.

title: Ozzy Osbourne says 2019 was the 'most painful, miserable' year of his life
description: A fall led to Ozzy Osbourne having the "worst" year of his life.

title: Clinton says 'nobody likes' Sanders and won't commit to backing him if he's the Democratic nominee
description: Hillary Clinton blasts Sen. Bernie Sanders in a new documentary, saying "nobody likes him" and declining in an interview with The Hollywood Reporter to say whether she would endorse and campaign for him if he's the Democratic 2020 nominee.

title: Meanwhile...: Here are today's other top stories
description: CNN's Bianca Nobilo brings you the top stories of the day away from Capitol Hill.

title: The US had deported a student from Iran. His attorney says he had a visa
description: An Iranian student admitted to Northeastern University was detained at Boston Logan International Airport and removed from the US, his attorney said.

title: Are we close to pilotless commercial jets?
description: The concept of pilotless commercial jet flight has been bandied about for years.

title: See why Howie Mandel used the 'golden buzzer' on 'AGT'
description: "America's Got Talent" judge Howie Mandel used the "golden buzzer" to move a dance crew to the show's finals. HLN's Melissa Knowles reports.

title: History: What the Founding Fathers would have said about this
description: What American politics needs is time travel.

title: Can smart sensors prevent crashes?
description: Road accidents kill around 1.3 million people and injure tens of millions more each year, according to the World Health Organization.

title: Mountain lion attacks 3-year-old boy
description: A mountain lion has been euthanized after attacking a 3-year-old boy at Whiting Ranch Wilderness Park in Southern California, authorities say. CNN affiliate KCAL/KCBS has more on the story.

title: Legal analyst: This is the real new atrocity McConnell added
description: CNN chief legal analyst Jeffrey Toobin and CNN political analyst Carl Bernstein break down the implications of Sen. Mitch McConnell's new proposed impeachment trial rules.

title: 100% of the homeless workers here can afford their own homes within months
description: In the shadows of Detroit's tallest skyscrapers, dozens of homeless people shiver in the 17-degree cold.

title: Shakespeare fans can stay in Juliet-inspired house this Valentine's Day
description: For Shakespeare enthusiasts and hopeless romantics, this year's Valentine's Day could be the most memorable yet.

title: Witness fight: GOP considers 'contingencies' over witnesses
description: The White House has been involved in discussions with GOP allies over the last several days to make sure they're ready in the event Democrats get enough votes to allow witnesses, such as former national security adviser John Bolton, to testify in President Donald Trump's impeachment trial, a senior administration official and a person familiar with the matter tell CNN.

title: Could Angela Merkel's successor be a Green?
description: Austria's first green-tinged government -- comprising the Austrian People's Party and the Austrian Green Party -- broke ground in the Alpine state earlier this month. Not only is the environmentalist Green Party in a national government for the first time, but the coalition's agenda will make Austria a trailblazer in climate protection. Germany's next general election, scheduled for 2021, however, might yield an even bigger bombshell: a Green chancellor for the first time in post-war continental Europe.

title: Two men could answer an unsolved rape case from 1978
Prince Harry rejoins Meghan in Canada
One year on: Sala's family still waiting for answers on soccer star's tragic death
description: A year after Emiliano Sala's death in a plane crash, the soccer player's family say they are still seeking answers to the tragedy.

title: The downfall of Maria Sharapova
description: For the third consecutive grand slam, Maria Sharapova has fallen to a first-round defeat. Now serious questions are being asked about her future.

title: Harry rejoins Meghan and Archie in Canada, leaving royal life behind
Lesbian couple 'overwhelmed with anger' after wedding venue turns them away
description: A South African wedding venue is facing criticism after the owners declined to host a lesbian couple's wedding because of their Christian beliefs.

title: Confirmed cases of China's new virus jump to 291, with six deaths
Trump's team badly miscalculated on Ukraine
description:
• ANALYSIS: How Trump wins a second term
• 8 things to watch at impeachment trial

title: Living in Amsterdam's red-light district
Disputed Van Gogh painting is genuine, says new study
description: A disputed painting of Vincent van Gogh has been declared a genuine self-portrait by the Dutch master, almost 50 years after its authenticity was first called into question.

title: Greta ignores Davos panel question to give warning
description: During a panel hosted by TIME, Greta Thunberg issues a stark warning about the IPCC's best case scenario for avoiding climate catastrophe.

title: The Titanic will be protected by a treaty between US and UK
Man arrested for leaving dad's remains in restroom, police say
description: A man has been arrested in Japan after allegedly abandoning his father's cremated remains in a subway station restroom.

title: Aquatic system older than the pyramids revealed by Australian bushfires
description: Extensive water channels built by indigenous Australians thousands of years ago to trap and harvest eels for food have been revealed after wildfires burned away thick vegetation in the state of Victoria.

title: US aircraft carrier to be named for African American hero
Uber sells its India food business for 9.99% stake in local rival Zomato
description: Uber has sold another business in Asia.

title: Joe Biden fires back at Bernie Sanders after video surfaces
description: CNN's Jeff Zeleny reports on the "circular firing squad" of leading Democratic rivals unfolding on multiple fronts.

title: See the Joe Biden moment that's going viral
description: A video of Joe Biden taking a selfie with an elevator operator on the way to his endorsement interview with The New York Times has accumulated thousands of views.
